Description: Large sherd (mended from four fragments) of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery krater, consisting of rim, neck, and top of shoulder; pale slip; interior streaky black with one large red band lined in white; on top of rim, maeander frieze; on rim edge, black bars; underside of rim reserved; neck glazed streaky black; on shoulder, part of eight tongues preserved pendent from ridge at join of neck and shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Cambridge NA7 and Oxford 1912.35(A) as well as Reading 26.2.56 and Bristol H2016.01. The piece consists of four fragments, only two of which are glued together. Each sherd is individually labelled: NA6a; NA6b; NA6c; NA6d.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.484)
